decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to control and manipulate the opponent's deck by using cards like Lantern of Insight, Codex Shredder, Ghoulcaller's Bell, and Pithing Needle. This allows the player to see and control the top card of the opponent's library, disrupting their draws and potentially locking them out of certain cards. Ensnaring Bridge is used to prevent the opponent's creatures from attacking, while cards like Abrupt Decay, Pyrite Spellbomb, and Surgical Extraction provide removal and disruption. The deck also includes some protection with Spellskite and interaction with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek.

The main concept of this deck is to create a powerful combo using Splinter Twin and either Pestermite or Deceiver Exarch. By enchanting one of these creatures with Splinter Twin, the player can repeatedly create token copies of the creature, generating an army of hasty attackers. The deck contains a mix of control elements, with cards like Cryptic Command and Remand to disrupt the opponent's plans and buy time to set up the combo. Snapcaster Mage provides additional value by allowing the player to recast important spells from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with low-cost artifact creatures and utilizing artifact synergies to pump them up and deal damage quickly. Cards like Cranial Plating and Galvanic Blast help to increase damage output, while cards like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager provide additional ways to buff up creatures. The deck also includes lands that can turn into creatures to provide additional threats. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle.

The main focus of this deck is to rapidly generate mana and flood the board with small Elf creatures, utilizing cards like Heritage Druid and Nettle Sentinel to produce additional mana and power out stronger creatures like Elvish Archdruid and Ezuri, Renegade Leader. Lead the Stampede and Collected Company are used to continually refill the hand with more Elves, while cards like Sylvan Messenger provide additional card draw and filtering. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of Elves and buff them up with Ezuri's abilities for a quick victory.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the Amulet of Vigor to generate massive amounts of mana and combo off with Primeval Titan. The deck includes cards like Summer Bloom and Azusa, Lost but Seeking to play additional lands per turn, allowing for explosive starts. The deck also includes multiple lands that generate multiple mana when they enter the battlefield, such as Simic Growth Chamber and Gruul Turf. This allows the deck to quickly ramp up and cast powerful spells like Primeval Titan to search for key lands and win conditions.

This Merfolk deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive creatures like Master of Waves, Lord of Atlantis, and Merrow Reejerey. Utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Spreading Seas, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while buffing its own creatures. By utilizing counterspells and bounce effects like Harbinger of the Tides, the deck aims to control the board and push for damage quickly. With a solid mana base and tribal synergies, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win through aggressive creature combat.

This deck aims to quickly deal damage to the opponent by playing cheap and efficient creatures and spells that deal damage directly to the opponent. It focuses on aggression and burn spells to control the board and pressure the opponent into a quick victory. By using creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear to chip away at the opponent's life total and burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to finish them off, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through the use of counterspells and removal, while ramping up mana with Sakura-Tribe Elder and Search for Tomorrow. The goal is to eventually cast Scapeshift, sacrificing the necessary number of lands to trigger Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle's ability and deal massive amounts of damage. Snapcaster Mage and Peer Through Depths provide additional card advantage and flexibility. This control-scapeshift hybrid deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up for a game-ending Scapeshift combo.

The main concept of this Naya Zoo deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient spells, putting pressure on them from the very beginning of the game. The deck's strategy revolves around deploying fast and powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Burning-Tree Emissary, and Goblin Guide, while also utilizing pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Atarka's Command to push through damage and control the board. By combining efficient creatures and burn spells, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total and win the game before they can stabilize.

This Modern Jund Aggro deck focuses on disrupting opponent's hands with discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while using efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to control the board. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. With a mix of efficient removal, hand disruption, and strong threats, this deck aims to maintain a strong tempo and overwhelm opponents in 1 vs 1 matchups.

The main focus of this Modern Naya Zoo deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. The deck features a lineup of powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Knight of the Reliquary, and Loxodon Smiter, supported by mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise. With Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile for removal, the deck aims to quickly close out the game by putting pressure on the opponent and maintaining board control. Additionally, Collected Company provides additional creature value and potential for explosive plays.

This deck aims to quickly assemble a board full of Elves while utilizing cards like Chord of Calling, Collected Company, and Lead the Stampede to find combo pieces and generate value. The key strategy is to generate a ton of mana with cards like Heritage Druid and Elvish Archdruid, allowing for explosive plays with Ezuri, Renegade Leader and Shaman of the Pack to drain the opponent's life total in one turn. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Spellskite and Elvish Champion to protect the Elves and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on building up a strong board presence with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Siege Rhino, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Abrupt Decay. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil provides additional control options. The deck also utilizes a mix of removal spells and disruptive lands to keep the opponent on the back foot. The overall strategy is to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game, overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while using sacrifice and graveyard recursion effects to gain incremental advantages. The combination of cards like Collected Company, Return to the Ranks, and Abzan Ascendancy allows for explosive plays and can quickly put the opponent on the back foot. By utilizing cards like Blood Artist and Viscera Seer, the deck can drain the opponent's life total and disrupt their game plan. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Splinter Twin combo, using either Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to untap a creature enchanted with Splinter Twin, creating an infinite number of hasty creature tokens for a lethal attack. The deck includes disruptive spells like Remand and Terminate to protect the combo, while also featuring powerful cards like Snapcaster Mage and Tasigur, the Golden Fang for card advantage and control. The mana base is designed to support the triple-color requirements of the deck, ensuring consistency in executing the combo.

This deck focuses on assembling the Splinter Twin combo with Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create an infinite loop of tokens with haste. The deck includes disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and counterspells like Remand and Spell Snare to protect the combo. It also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to deal with threats. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage allows for additional value by recasting important spells from the graveyard. Tasigur, the Golden Fang provides card advantage while Spellskite can protect the combo pieces.
